nutrition.tipSaveHint: Tap the heart icon to save your favorite tips to The Vault
nutrition.title: Iron Horse Production
nutrition.subtitle: Dietary & Holistic Health for Elite Athletes
nutrition.disclaimerText: The information provided is for educational purposes only and should not replace professional medical advice. Some information may be inaccurate or outdated.
nutrition.noMoreTips: You've collected your 2 health tips for today! Come back tomorrow for more.
nutrition.educationalPurposes: The information provided here is for educational purposes only and should not replace professional medical advice.
nutrition.aiTipsWarning: AI-generated tips may contain inaccuracies. Some information may be outdated or incorrect.
nutrition.alwaysConsult: Always consult with a qualified healthcare provider before making any changes to your diet or health routine.

categories.bloodTypeDesc: Optimize nutrition based on your blood type
categories.hydrationDesc: Master proper fluid intake for peak performance
categories.longevityDesc: Nutrition for a long athletic career
categories.dailyNutritionDesc: Quick daily tips for better eating

bloodType.content1: Type O: Focus on lean proteins, fish, and vegetables. Limit dairy and wheat.
bloodType.content2: Type A: Plant-based foods work best. Include soy, grains, and organic vegetables.
bloodType.content3: Type B: Enjoy diverse foods including meat, dairy, grains, and vegetables.
bloodType.content4: Type AB: Combine recommendations from A and B types. Seafood and tofu are excellent.
bloodType.content5: All types benefit from proper hydration and avoiding processed foods.

hydration.content1: Drink half your body weight in ounces of water daily as a baseline.
hydration.content2: Pre-hydrate 2-3 hours before training with 16-20 oz of water.
hydration.content3: During exercise, drink 7-10 oz every 10-20 minutes.
hydration.content4: Post-workout: Replace 150% of fluid lost through sweat.
hydration.content5: Monitor urine color - pale yellow indicates good hydration.

minerals.content1: Magnesium supports muscle function and recovery. Sources: nuts, seeds, leafy greens.
minerals.content2: Zinc aids protein synthesis and immune function. Found in meat, shellfish, legumes.
minerals.content3: Iron carries oxygen to muscles. Athletes need more than sedentary individuals.
minerals.content4: Calcium builds strong bones. Important for high-impact athletes.
minerals.content5: Potassium prevents cramping. Bananas, potatoes, and avocados are rich sources.

recovery.content1: Consume protein within 30 minutes post-workout for optimal muscle repair.
recovery.content2: Quality sleep (7-9 hours) is essential for growth hormone release.
recovery.content3: Include anti-inflammatory foods: berries, fatty fish, turmeric.
recovery.content4: Active recovery days improve blood flow without additional stress.
recovery.content5: Cold/heat therapy can accelerate tissue repair and reduce soreness.

bloodFlow.content1: Nitrate-rich foods like beets improve circulation and oxygen delivery.
bloodFlow.content2: Dark chocolate (70%+ cacao) supports vascular health.
bloodFlow.content3: Garlic and onions naturally thin blood and improve flow.
bloodFlow.content4: Omega-3 fatty acids reduce inflammation in blood vessels.
bloodFlow.content5: Regular movement throughout the day prevents blood pooling.

lymphatic.content1: Dry brushing before showers stimulates lymphatic drainage.
lymphatic.content2: Rebounding (mini trampoline) is excellent for lymph movement.
lymphatic.content3: Deep breathing exercises move lymph through the thoracic duct.
lymphatic.content4: Stay hydrated - lymph fluid is primarily water.
lymphatic.content5: Reduce processed foods that burden the lymphatic system.

vitamins.content1: Vitamin D: Essential for bone health and immune function. Get sunlight or supplement.
vitamins.content2: B vitamins convert food to energy. Found in whole grains and meats.
vitamins.content3: Vitamin C supports collagen production for connective tissue health.
vitamins.content4: Vitamin E protects cells from exercise-induced oxidative stress.
vitamins.content5: Vitamin K2 directs calcium to bones, not arteries.

dailyNutrition.content1: Eat the rainbow - different colored vegetables provide unique nutrients.
dailyNutrition.content2: Protein at every meal supports stable blood sugar and satiety.
dailyNutrition.content3: Complex carbs before training provide sustained energy.
dailyNutrition.content4: Healthy fats (olive oil, avocado, nuts) support hormone production.
dailyNutrition.content5: Minimize sugar and processed foods that cause inflammation.

longevity.content1: Caloric moderation without malnutrition extends healthspan.
longevity.content3: Maintain muscle mass through resistance training and protein.
longevity.content4: Manage stress - cortisol accelerates aging processes.
longevity.content5: Social connections and purpose contribute to longevity.

weight.content1: Focus on body composition, not just scale weight.
weight.content2: Protein intake (0.8-1g per pound) supports muscle during weight loss.
weight.content3: Gradual changes (1-2 lbs/week) preserve muscle mass.
weight.content5: Sleep deprivation increases hunger hormones - prioritize rest.

vegan.content1: Combine plant proteins (beans + rice) for complete amino acids.
vegan.content2: Supplement B12 - it's only found naturally in animal products.
vegan.content3: Include iron-rich foods with vitamin C for better absorption.
vegan.content4: Omega-3s from algae, flax, chia, and walnuts.
vegan.content5: Creatine supplementation may benefit vegan athletes.

restrictive.content1: Gluten-free athletes: Choose quinoa, rice, and certified GF oats.
restrictive.content2: Dairy-free: Fortified plant milks provide calcium and vitamin D.
restrictive.content3: Low-FODMAP for digestive issues: Work with a dietitian.
restrictive.content4: Keto athletes may need adaptation period for high-intensity work.
restrictive.content5: Always consult healthcare providers before eliminating food groups.

offseason.content1: Increase calories gradually to support muscle building.
offseason.content2: Focus on strength training and skill development.
offseason.content3: Address any nutritional deficiencies identified during season.
offseason.content4: Experiment with new foods and meal timing strategies.
offseason.content5: Allow mental recovery from strict in-season protocols.

inseason.content1: Maintain consistent eating patterns on game and practice days.
inseason.content3: Stay on top of hydration - don't wait until you're thirsty.
inseason.content4: Post-game nutrition is crucial for next-day performance.
inseason.content5: Avoid trying new foods close to competition.

performance.content1: Pre-game meal 3-4 hours before: Familiar, easily digestible foods.
performance.content2: Carbohydrates are the primary fuel for high-intensity performance.
performance.content3: Caffeine (3-6mg/kg) 30-60 minutes before can enhance performance.
performance.content4: Stay calm - stress hormones impair digestion and performance.
performance.content5: Visualize success while fueling your body.

ingameHydration.content1: Sip fluids between innings or during breaks - don't guzzle.
ingameHydration.content2: Sports drinks help if playing over 60 minutes in heat.
ingameHydration.content3: Electrolyte tablets can be added to water in hot conditions.
ingameHydration.content4: Avoid sugary drinks that cause energy crashes.
ingameHydration.content5: Monitor sweat rate to personalize fluid replacement.

supplements.content1: NSF Certified for Sport ensures products are safe for athletes.
supplements.content2: Protein powder: Convenient for post-workout or meal supplementation.
supplements.content3: Creatine monohydrate: Well-researched for power and strength.
supplements.content5: Always check with your organization's banned substance list.

holistic.content1: Mind-body connection: Stress affects nutrient absorption.
holistic.content2: Mindful eating improves digestion and satisfaction.
holistic.content3: Gratitude practices reduce cortisol and inflammation.
holistic.content4: Nature exposure supports mental and physical recovery.
holistic.content5: Community and team meals enhance the eating experience.

welcome.title: Welcome to Hammers Modality
welcome.description: Your complete baseball training and scouting platform. Analyze your performance with AI-powered feedback, connect with scouts, and track your progress to the next level.

creator.title: Meet the Creator
creator.description: Learn about the developer and owner of Hammers Modality. Visit the Owner Bio section in the sidebar to view their background, credentials, and contact information.

modules.title: Your Training Modules
modules.description: Access your Hitting, Pitching, and Throwing analysis tools. Each module is designed with cutting-edge AI to help you improve specific aspects of your game.

upload.title: Upload & Analyze Videos
upload.description: Use the module cards to upload videos of your workouts or games. Our AI analyzes your mechanics in real-time, providing instant feedback on your technique.

coaching.title: Get Personalized Coaching
coaching.description: Receive detailed efficiency scores, customized drills, and technique feedback tailored to your performance. Improve specific areas with data-driven recommendations.

library.title: Your Video Library
library.description: All your videos are saved in the Players Club. Review past analyses, mark videos as private or public, and share them with scouts and coaches following you.

following.title: Build Your Following
following.description: View scouts and coaches following you in My Followers. Accept or decline follow requests, and control who can see your public training videos.

ranking.title: Track Your Ranking
ranking.description: Your ranking updates automatically based on scout and coach engagement. The more visibility you gain through quality content, the higher you climb!

profile.title: Complete Your Profile
profile.description: Visit Settings to add your bio, upload photos, list teams and schools, and connect social media. This information is visible to scouts‚Äîmake it count!

welcome.title: Welcome Scouts & Coaches
welcome.description: Your comprehensive scouting platform to discover, evaluate, and follow talented players. Access detailed profiles, training videos, and performance analytics.

creator.title: Meet the Creator
creator.description: Learn about the developer and owner of Hammers Modality. Visit the Owner Bio section in the sidebar to view their background and credentials.

discover.title: Discover Talent
discover.description: Use the Scout Dashboard to search for players based on name, position, location, and more. Find hidden gems and track rising stars in baseball and softball.

search.title: Advanced Player Search
search.description: Apply filters to narrow your search by position, throwing hand, batting side, height, weight, graduation year, state, and commitment status for precise talent scouting.

follow.title: Follow Players
follow.description: Send follow requests to players you're interested in. When they accept, you gain access to all their public training videos and performance data.

videos.title: View Player Videos
videos.description: Once you're following a player, access their entire video library in the Players Club. Watch their training sessions, game footage, and AI analysis breakdowns.

rankings.title: Rankings System
rankings.description: Players are automatically ranked based on their engagement and visibility with scouts. The more scouts following and interacting with a player, the higher they rank.

analyze.title: Analyze Performance
analyze.description: Review AI-generated reports for each player, including efficiency scores, mechanics analysis, and detailed feedback to help you make informed recruiting decisions.

gameDayPrep.title: Game Day Prep
gameDayPrep.sunBelowHorizon: Sun is below the horizon at this time
gameDayPrep.noSunIssues: No significant sun glare issues expected
gameDayPrep.coldWarmupExercise1: Light jog (10 min) ‚Äî Build core body temperature gradually
gameDayPrep.coldWarmupExercise2: Dynamic stretches (10 min) ‚Äî Leg swings, arm circles, high knees
gameDayPrep.coldWarmupExercise3: Throwing progression ‚Äî Start at 20ft, gradually increase distance
gameDayPrep.coldWarmupTip: Extra time needed for cold muscles. Focus on gradual heat generation to prevent injury.
gameDayPrep.coolWarmupExercise1: Jog (8 min) ‚Äî Moderate pace to raise body temperature
gameDayPrep.coolWarmupExercise2: Dynamic stretches (7 min) ‚Äî Focus on shoulders, hips, and legs
gameDayPrep.coolWarmupTip: Extra attention to shoulders and legs to prevent strains in cooler temps.
gameDayPrep.moderateWarmupExercise1: Light jog (5 min) ‚Äî Easy pace warmup
gameDayPrep.moderateWarmupTip: Ideal conditions for standard warmup protocol.
gameDayPrep.warmWarmupExercise1: Light jog or brisk walk (5 min)
gameDayPrep.warmWarmupExercise2: Quick dynamic stretches ‚Äî Keep it brief
gameDayPrep.warmWarmupTip: Keep intensity lower and hydration higher. Take water breaks.
gameDayPrep.hotWarmupExercise1: Walking stretches in shade when possible
gameDayPrep.hotWarmupExercise3: Minimal throwing to save energy for game
gameDayPrep.hotWarmupTip: Minimize exertion to conserve energy. Stay in shade. Hydrate constantly.
gameDayPrep.coldWeatherGear: Thermal base layers, fleece jacket, warm hat, batting gloves recommended
gameDayPrep.coolWeatherGear: Long sleeve undershirt, light jacket for dugout breaks
gameDayPrep.moderateWeatherGear: Standard uniform, light sleeves optional for comfort
gameDayPrep.hotWeatherGear: Lightweight breathable fabrics, cooling towel, extra hydration gear
gameDayPrep.uvHigh: SPF 50+ essential, protective eyewear, secure cap
gameDayPrep.uvVeryHigh: Maximum sun protection, limit direct sun exposure
gameDayPrep.uvExtreme: Avoid midday sun if possible, full UV protection required
gameDayPrep.windModerate: Secure cap, lightweight windbreaker for dugout
gameDayPrep.windStrong: Windproof outer layer, secure all loose equipment
gameDayPrep.copiedToClipboard: Game Day Prep copied to clipboard!
gameDayPrep.precipitationPossible: Possible rain ‚Äî pack light rain gear and equipment covers
gameDayPrep.precipitationLikely: Rain likely ‚Äî bring rain jacket, tarp, and protect all equipment
gameDayPrep.precipitationHigh: High chance of rain ‚Äî full rain preparation recommended, consider delays

hurting.title: Normal Soreness ("Hurting")
hurting.description: These sensations are typically part of athletic training:
hurting.sign1: Muscle soreness that improves with movement
hurting.sign2: Mild stiffness that decreases after warming up

injured.title: Potential Injury ("Injured")
injured.description: These signs may indicate something more serious:
injured.sign2: Pain that gets worse with movement
injured.sign4: Inability to bear weight or use the affected area

note.title: Remember
note.description: This is for self-reflection only, not diagnosis. When in doubt, always consult a medical professional.

diagnosticFlow.intro: Use this educational flow chart to reflect on your symptoms. This teaches recognition, not diagnosis.

symptoms.title: Identify Your Symptoms
symptoms.q1: Where exactly is the discomfort located?
symptoms.q2: What type of sensation is it (sharp, dull, aching)?
symptoms.q3: Does it affect your movement or performance?

timing.title: Consider the Timing
timing.q1: Did it start suddenly or gradually?
timing.q2: How long have you had these symptoms?
timing.q3: Is it constant or does it come and go?

severity.title: Assess Severity
severity.q2: Is the area swollen or discolored?
severity.q3: Is the pain getting better, worse, or staying the same?

decision.title: Consider Your Options
decision.description: Based on your reflection, consider these pathways:

outcome1.condition: Severe symptoms, sudden onset, or red flags present

outcome3.action: Continue monitoring, apply RICE principles if appropriate

painScale.intro: Use this scale as a personal awareness tool to reflect on your pain levels. This helps you communicate with healthcare providers.

minimal.label: Minimal
minimal.description: Barely noticeable discomfort that doesn't affect daily activities.
minimal.recommendation: Generally safe to continue normal activities with awareness.

mild.label: Mild
mild.description: Noticeable but doesn't significantly interfere with activities.
mild.recommendation: Consider modifying intensity. Monitor for changes.

moderate.label: Moderate
moderate.description: Interferes with concentration and some activities.
moderate.recommendation: Consider rest and reducing activity. Evaluation may be beneficial.

severe.label: Severe
severe.description: Significantly impacts ability to perform normal activities.
severe.recommendation: Rest recommended. Professional evaluation strongly advised.

extreme.label: Extreme
extreme.description: Overwhelming pain that prevents normal function.
extreme.recommendation: Stop all activity. Seek professional help immediately.

redFlags.intro: Check any symptoms you're experiencing. This helps identify warning signs that may warrant professional attention.

items.numbness: Numbness, tingling, or loss of sensation
items.inability: Complete inability to bear weight or use the limb
items.popSound: Heard or felt a "pop" during injury
items.lockedJoint: Joint is locked or won't move normally
items.instability: Joint feels unstable or gives way
items.fever: Fever or signs of infection (warmth, redness)

critical.title: Immediate Attention Recommended
critical.description: One or more critical warning signs are present. Professional evaluation is strongly recommended as soon as possible.

high.title: Professional Evaluation Advised
high.description: Significant warning signs are present. Consider seeking professional evaluation within 24-48 hours.

moderate.title: Monitor Closely
moderate.description: Some warning signs present. Monitor your symptoms and consider professional consultation if they worsen.

clear.title: No Red Flags Detected
clear.description: No major warning signs currently selected. Continue monitoring your condition.

disclaimer.title: Important Reminder
disclaimer.description: This checklist is educational only. It does not replace professional medical evaluation. When in doubt, always consult a healthcare provider.

disclaimer.title: IMPORTANT MEDICAL DISCLAIMER
disclaimer.subtitle: Please read this carefully before using Bounce Back Bay

educational.title: Educational Purposes Only
educational.description: All content is for general educational information only.

noDiagnosis.title: Not Medical Advice
noDiagnosis.description: This does not diagnose, treat, or prescribe rehabilitation.

seekHelp.title: Consult Professionals
seekHelp.description: Always consult licensed medical or PT professionals for injuries.

emergency.title: Emergency Situations
emergency.description: Severe or worsening symptoms require immediate professional evaluation.

fullText.para1: Bounce Back Bay is designed to provide general educational information about common sports injuries and recovery concepts.
fullText.para2: The information provided here is NOT intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Never disregard professional medical advice or delay in seeking it because of something you have read in this module.
fullText.para3: All techniques, exercises, and recovery concepts described are for informational purposes only and should only be performed under the guidance of qualified healthcare professionals. Individual results may vary, and what works for one person may not be appropriate for another.
fullText.warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è If you experience severe pain, sudden injury, or any concerning symptoms, STOP all activity and seek immediate professional medical attention.

disclaimer.bottomNote: By using Bounce Back Bay, you acknowledge that you have read and understood this disclaimer.

returnToPlay.intro: Understanding the typical phases of recovery can help you set realistic expectations. Always work with healthcare professionals to determine your specific timeline.

protection.title: Protection & Symptom Reduction
protection.description: The initial phase focuses on protecting the injured area and managing acute symptoms.
protection.focus1: Rest and protect the injured area

restore.title: Restore Movement & Function
restore.description: Gradually restore range of motion and basic functional movements.

strengthen.title: Strengthening & Controlled Activity
strengthen.description: Build strength and begin sport-related movements in controlled settings.

return.title: Return to Sport
return.description: The final phase involves full sport-specific training and return to competition.

progressionNote.title: Progression is Individual
progressionNote.description: Every recovery is different. Progression should be guided by symptoms and professional evaluation, not arbitrary timelines.

injuryPrevention.intro: Prevention education can help reduce injury risk. These concepts should be applied under professional guidance as part of a comprehensive training program.

warmup.title: Warm-Up Concepts
warmup.subtitle: Preparing the body for activity
warmup.tip1: Dynamic stretching before activity increases blood flow
warmup.tip2: Sport-specific movement prep activates relevant muscle groups
warmup.tip3: Gradual intensity progression allows the body to adapt

strength.title: Strength Training
strength.subtitle: Building resilient muscles and joints
strength.tip1: Progressive overload builds tissue tolerance over time
strength.tip2: Balanced training addresses both agonist and antagonist muscles
strength.tip3: Core stability supports efficient movement patterns

mobility.title: Mobility & Flexibility
mobility.subtitle: Maintaining optimal movement quality
mobility.tip1: Joint mobility work supports healthy movement ranges
mobility.tip3: Regular movement variety prevents pattern overload

sportSpecific.title: Sport-Specific Prevention
sportSpecific.subtitle: Baseball and softball focused strategies
sportSpecific.tip1: Pitch count awareness helps manage arm workload
sportSpecific.tip2: Proper throwing mechanics reduce stress on joints

patterns.title: Common Prevention Patterns
patterns.subtitle: Habits that may help reduce injury risk
patterns.pattern4: Listen to your body and respect warning signs

recoveryMethods.intro: Understanding when and how to use different recovery methods can support your healing process. Always consult with healthcare professionals for specific guidance.

ice.title: Ice / Cold Therapy
ice.subtitle: Cryotherapy for acute situations
ice.timing: Typically 15-20 minutes at a time, with breaks between applications

heat.title: Heat Therapy
heat.subtitle: Thermotherapy for chronic conditions
heat.use2: Before activity to promote blood flow
heat.timing: Typically 15-20 minutes, avoid on acute injuries or swelling

rest.title: Rest & Sleep
rest.description: Quality sleep is when most tissue repair occurs. Prioritize 7-9 hours nightly.

hydration.title: Hydration
hydration.description: Adequate fluid intake supports nutrient delivery and waste removal from tissues.

equipmentLibrary.intro: Understanding common recovery equipment can help you make informed decisions when working with healthcare professionals. These tools are typically used under professional guidance.
equipmentLibrary.noResults: No equipment found matching your search.

kinesioTape.name: Kinesio Tape
kinesioTape.description: Elastic therapeutic tape that provides support while allowing range of motion.
kinesioTape.usage: Often used for muscle support, reducing swelling, and providing proprioceptive feedback.

athleticTape.name: Athletic Tape
athleticTape.description: Non-elastic tape that provides firm support and joint stabilization.
athleticTape.usage: Used for joint support, preventing excessive movement, and injury prevention.

compressionSleeve.name: Compression Sleeve
compressionSleeve.description: Elastic sleeve providing graduated compression to support circulation.
compressionSleeve.usage: Used for reducing swelling, providing warmth, and supporting recovery.

kneeSleeve.name: Knee Sleeve
kneeSleeve.description: Neoprene or elastic sleeve specifically designed for knee support.
kneeSleeve.usage: Provides compression, warmth, and proprioceptive feedback during activity.

resistanceBands.name: Resistance Bands
resistanceBands.description: Elastic bands used for strengthening exercises with variable resistance.
resistanceBands.usage: Rehabilitation exercises, warm-up routines, and progressive strengthening.

therapyBands.name: Therapy Bands
therapyBands.description: Flat elastic bands typically used in physical therapy settings.
therapyBands.usage: Gentle strengthening, range of motion exercises, and rehabilitation programs.

foamRoller.name: Foam Roller
foamRoller.description: Cylindrical foam tool used for self-massage and myofascial release.
foamRoller.usage: Pre and post-activity muscle preparation, reducing muscle tension.

massageBall.name: Massage Ball
massageBall.description: Small, firm ball used for targeted soft tissue work.
massageBall.usage: Targeting specific muscle knots, trigger points, and tight areas.

ankleBrace.name: Ankle Brace
ankleBrace.description: Supportive device that limits ankle movement and provides stability.
ankleBrace.usage: Injury prevention, post-injury support, and return-to-play protection.

wristSupport.name: Wrist Support
wristSupport.description: Wrap or brace providing support to the wrist joint.
wristSupport.usage: Supporting wrist during activity, managing discomfort, and injury prevention.

Always warm up properly, monitor arm fatigue, and consult with a qualified professional before beginning any throwing program. Stop immediately if you experience arm pain.

visualization_week.title: Visualization Week
visualization_week.description: Spend 5 minutes visualizing perfect performance before practice.

discipline_week.title: Discipline Week
discipline_week.description: Complete your morning routine 7 days in a row without excuses.

encouragement_week.title: Encouragement Week
encouragement_week.description: Be the first to encourage a teammate who makes an error.

presence_week.title: Presence Week
presence_week.description: Put your phone away 1 hour before practice or games.

accountability_week.title: Accountability Week
accountability_week.description: Hold yourself publicly accountable for one goal this week.

calm_week.title: Calm Week
calm_week.description: Practice the 4-7-8 breathing technique 3 times daily.

purpose_week.title: Purpose Week
purpose_week.description: Write your personal mission statement and review it daily.

energy_week.title: Energy Week
energy_week.description: Be the first to bring positive energy to every practice.

reset_day.title: Reset Day
reset_day.description: Complete a 24-hour digital detox from social media.

affirmation_week.title: Affirmation Week
affirmation_week.description: Repeat 3 positive affirmations to yourself every morning and night.

confidence_week.title: Confidence Week
confidence_week.description: Walk with confident posture and make eye contact for every interaction.

concentration_week.title: Concentration Week
concentration_week.description: Practice single-tasking - focus on one thing at a time without distractions.

mental_toughness_week.title: Mental Toughness Week
mental_toughness_week.description: When things get hard, say 'bring it on' and push through.

positive_self_talk_week.title: Positive Self-Talk Week

goal_setting_week.title: Goal Setting Week

pressure_handling_week.title: Pressure Handling Week

clutch_mindset_week.title: Clutch Mindset Week
clutch_mindset_week.description: Visualize succeeding in high-pressure moments before bed each night.

competitive_edge_week.title: Competitive Edge Week
competitive_edge_week.description: Find one extra thing to improve on each day beyond regular practice.

mental_reset_week.title: Mental Reset Week
mental_reset_week.description: Use a reset word or gesture after every mistake to clear your mind.

game_day_focus_week.title: Game Day Focus Week
game_day_focus_week.description: Create and follow a pre-game mental preparation routine.

self_compassion_week.title: Self-Compassion Week
self_compassion_week.description: Treat yourself with kindness when you make mistakes - no harsh self-criticism.

mindfulness_week.title: Mindfulness Week
mindfulness_week.description: Spend 5 minutes each day in quiet mindful awareness.

stress_release_week.title: Stress Release Week
stress_release_week.description: Practice progressive muscle relaxation before sleep each night.

emotional_control_week.title: Emotional Control Week
emotional_control_week.description: Pause and take 3 deep breaths before reacting to any frustration.

joy_week.title: Joy Week
joy_week.description: Find and appreciate one moment of pure joy in your sport each day.

patience_week.title: Patience Week
patience_week.description: Practice patience in one challenging situation each day.

resilience_week.title: Resilience Week
resilience_week.description: After every setback, write down what you learned from it.

letting_go_week.title: Letting Go Week
letting_go_week.description: Release one worry or regret each day through journaling.

inner_peace_week.title: Inner Peace Week
inner_peace_week.description: Start and end each day with 2 minutes of peaceful silence.

emotional_awareness_week.title: Emotional Awareness Week
emotional_awareness_week.description: Check in with your emotions 3 times daily and name what you feel.

communication_week.title: Communication Week
communication_week.description: Practice active listening - repeat back what teammates say before responding.

mentorship_week.title: Mentorship Week
mentorship_week.description: Help a younger or less experienced teammate with one skill each day.

team_spirit_week.title: Team Spirit Week
team_spirit_week.description: Do one thing each day that benefits the team but not yourself directly.

lead_by_example_week.title: Lead By Example Week
lead_by_example_week.description: Be first to arrive and last to leave every practice.

inspire_others_week.title: Inspire Others Week
inspire_others_week.description: Share an inspiring quote or story with your team each day.

conflict_resolution_week.title: Conflict Resolution Week
conflict_resolution_week.description: Address one small conflict or tension directly and constructively.

servant_leadership_week.title: Servant Leadership Week
servant_leadership_week.description: Ask teammates 'how can I help you today?' and follow through.

positivity_spread_week.title: Positivity Spread Week
positivity_spread_week.description: Give 5 genuine compliments to different people each day.

team_culture_week.title: Team Culture Week
team_culture_week.description: Uphold team values even when no one is watching.

boundary_week.title: Boundary Week
boundary_week.description: Set and maintain one healthy boundary in your life this week.

habit_stack_week.title: Habit Stacking Week
habit_stack_week.description: Attach a new positive habit to an existing daily routine.

time_management_week.title: Time Management Week
time_management_week.description: Plan your next day the night before with specific time blocks.

sleep_optimization_week.title: Sleep Optimization Week
sleep_optimization_week.description: Go to bed and wake up at the same time every day this week.

nutrition_focus_week.title: Nutrition Focus Week
nutrition_focus_week.description: Eat a balanced meal with protein, carbs, and vegetables at every meal.

recovery_week.title: Recovery Week
recovery_week.description: Spend 15 minutes on recovery activities (stretching, foam rolling) daily.

work_life_balance_week.title: Work-Life Balance Week
work_life_balance_week.description: Dedicate quality time to relationships outside of your sport each day.

digital_detox_week.title: Digital Detox Week
digital_detox_week.description: Limit social media to 30 minutes total per day.

morning_routine_week.title: Morning Routine Week
morning_routine_week.description: Create and follow a consistent 30-minute morning routine.

evening_routine_week.title: Evening Routine Week
evening_routine_week.description: Create and follow a relaxing 30-minute evening wind-down routine.

activeRecovery.name: Active Recovery
activeRecovery.hittingDesc: Light stretching, foam rolling, or complete rest. Allow muscles to recover from strength training.
activeRecovery.pitchingDesc: Light stretching, foam rolling, or complete rest. Allow muscles and arm to recover. Light J-band work optional.
activeRecovery.pitchingDesc2: Light stretching, foam rolling, or complete rest. Prepare for next strength session. J-band arm care encouraged.

trap_bar_deadlift.name: Trap Bar Deadlift
trap_bar_deadlift.description: Stand inside hex bar, grip handles at sides, drive through heels to stand tall. Hips and knees extend simultaneously. Explosive concentric, controlled descent.

barbell_back_squat.name: Barbell Back Squat
barbell_back_squat.description: Bar on upper traps, feet shoulder-width apart. Descend until hip crease below knee, then explode up through midfoot. Chest stays high throughout.

bench_press.name: Bench Press
bench_press.description: Lie on bench with slight arch, grip bar just outside shoulders. Lower to mid-chest with control, pause briefly, then press explosively to lockout.
bench_press.notes: Pause at chest, drive through heels

barbell_row.name: Barbell Row
barbell_row.description: Hinge at hips 45¬∞, grip bar outside knees. Pull to lower ribcage while retracting shoulder blades. Keep torso stable - no heaving.

landmine_rotational_press.name: Landmine Rotational Press
landmine_rotational_press.description: Bar anchored in corner. Start at shoulder with both hands, rotate hips explosively while pressing diagonally across body. Core drives the movement.

isometric_wall_sit.name: Isometric Wall Sit
isometric_wall_sit.description: Back flat against wall, slide down until thighs parallel to floor. Press lower back into wall, engage quads maximally. Breathe steadily.

isometric_pallof_hold.name: Isometric Pallof Hold
isometric_pallof_hold.description: Cable/band at chest height, arms extended forward. Resist the rotational pull with your core - anti-rotation is the goal.

front_squat.name: Front Squat
front_squat.description: Bar on front delts with clean grip or crossed arms. Keep elbows high, descend deep with upright torso, drive up explosively through midfoot.

incline_db_press.name: Incline Dumbbell Press
incline_db_press.description: On 30¬∞ incline, press dumbbells from shoulder level to full lockout. Lower with control, slight pause at bottom, explode up.

weighted_pullup.name: Weighted Pull-Up
weighted_pullup.description: Add weight via belt or vest. From dead hang, pull until chin clears bar. Control descent, pause at bottom. Full ROM every rep.

romanian_deadlift.name: Romanian Deadlift
romanian_deadlift.description: Bar at hip height, push hips back while keeping slight knee bend. Lower until hamstring stretch, then drive hips forward to return.

cable_woodchop_high_low.name: Cable Woodchop High-to-Low
cable_woodchop_high_low.description: High cable attachment, feet shoulder-width. Pull diagonally down across body with hip rotation. Arms stay extended, core drives the movement.

isometric_pushup_hold.name: Isometric Push-Up Hold
isometric_pushup_hold.description: Lower to mid-position of push-up (elbows at 90¬∞). Hold steady without sinking or rising. Engage chest, triceps, and core maximally.

isometric_single_glute_bridge.name: Isometric Single-Leg Glute Bridge
isometric_single_glute_bridge.description: One foot planted, other leg extended. Drive hip up, hold at top with straight line from knee to shoulder. Maximum glute squeeze.

box_squat.name: Box Squat
box_squat.description: Squat back to box at parallel height. Pause briefly on box with tension maintained, then explode up. Teaches proper hip mechanics.

close_grip_bench.name: Close-Grip Bench Press
close_grip_bench.description: Grip bar shoulder-width, elbows tucked at 45¬∞. Lower to lower chest, pause, press explosively. Emphasizes tricep strength for finish.

single_arm_db_row.name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Row
single_arm_db_row.description: One hand and knee on bench, opposite foot planted wide. Row dumbbell to hip while actively resisting torso rotation. Control eccentric.

bulgarian_split_squat.name: Bulgarian Split Squat
bulgarian_split_squat.description: Rear foot elevated on bench behind you. Lower until front thigh parallel, then push through front heel to stand. Keep torso upright.

pallof_press.name: Pallof Press
pallof_press.description: Cable at chest height, stand perpendicular. Press hands forward slowly, hold 3s at extension while resisting rotation, return with control.

isometric_inverted_row.name: Isometric Inverted Row Hold
isometric_inverted_row.description: Under bar at chest height, pull up and hold with chest near bar. Body in straight line from ankles to shoulders. Squeeze shoulder blades.

isometric_side_plank.name: Isometric Side Plank
isometric_side_plank.description: On elbow and side of foot. Hold body in straight line with hips elevated off ground. Actively push through grounded elbow.

sumo_deadlift.name: Sumo Deadlift
sumo_deadlift.description: Wide stance, grip inside knees. Drive through heels, push knees out, chest up. Lockout with hips through. Emphasizes hip power.

overhead_press.name: Overhead Press
overhead_press.description: Bar at front shoulders, grip just outside shoulders. Brace core, press straight up while moving head back then forward. Full lockout overhead.

lat_pulldown.name: Lat Pulldown
lat_pulldown.description: Wide grip on bar, pull down to upper chest while arching slightly. Squeeze lats at bottom, control return. Full stretch at top.

walking_lunge.name: Walking Lunge
walking_lunge.description: Dumbbells at sides, step forward into deep lunge position. Drive through front heel to step forward into next lunge. Continuous motion.

medball_rotational_slam.name: Med Ball Rotational Slam
medball_rotational_slam.description: Med ball at hip, rotate explosively and slam ball diagonally down. Chase the ball, reset, repeat. Maximum rotational power output.

isometric_split_squat.name: Isometric Split Squat Hold
isometric_split_squat.description: Bottom position of split squat, front thigh parallel. Hold position without moving, maintaining upright torso and engaged glutes.

isometric_hollow_body.name: Isometric Hollow Body Hold
isometric_hollow_body.description: Lie on back, lower back pressed into floor. Legs extended slightly off ground, arms overhead. Hold position without breaking core.

incline_barbell_press.name: Incline Barbell Press
incline_barbell_press.description: On 30¬∞ incline with barbell. Lower to upper chest, pause, drive explosively. Upper chest emphasis.

chest_supported_row.name: Chest-Supported Row
chest_supported_row.description: Chest on incline bench, row dumbbells or bar to ribcage. Eliminates momentum, pure back strength.

db_shoulder_press.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
db_shoulder_press.description: Seated or standing, press dumbbells from shoulder level to full overhead lockout. Control descent.

cable_woodchop_low_high.name: Cable Woodchop Low-to-High
cable_woodchop_low_high.description: Low cable attachment. Pull diagonally up across body with explosive hip rotation. Upward power production.

isometric_dead_hang.name: Isometric Dead Hang
isometric_dead_hang.description: Hang from pull-up bar with straight arms. Engages grip, stretches lats, decompresses spine.

db_bench_press.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
db_bench_press.description: Independent arm pressing for balance and stability. Full range of motion, pause at bottom.

pallof_press_step.name: Pallof Press with Step
pallof_press_step.description: Dynamic anti-rotation. Press hands forward while stepping laterally, increasing lever arm.

isometric_anti_rotation.name: Isometric Anti-Rotation Hold
isometric_anti_rotation.description: Cable/band at chest height. Arms extended, resist pull. Core stability maintenance.

glute_bridge_march.name: Glute Bridge March
glute_bridge_march.description: Bridge position, alternate lifting knees while maintaining level hips. Dynamic hip stability.

step_up.name: Step-Up
step_up.description: High box step-up with dumbbells. Drive through top leg, minimal push from back leg.

plank_shoulder_tap.name: Plank with Shoulder Tap
plank_shoulder_tap.description: Plank position, alternate tapping shoulders while minimizing hip rotation. Core control.

isometric_hip_flexor.name: Isometric Hip Flexor Hold
isometric_hip_flexor.description: Standing, pull knee to chest against resistance. Hold with hip flexor engaged at maximum contraction.

isometric_lunge_hold.name: Isometric Lunge Hold
isometric_lunge_hold.description: Bottom of lunge position, hold with tension. Develops positional strength.

deficit_trap_bar.name: Deficit Trap Bar Deadlift
deficit_trap_bar.description: Stand on 2-3" platform inside hex bar. Increased ROM demands greater hip and leg drive. Explosive concentric.

pause_squat.name: Pause Squat
pause_squat.description: 3-second pause at bottom of squat. Eliminates stretch reflex, builds strength from dead stop.

spoto_press.name: Spoto Press
spoto_press.description: Pause 1" off chest for 2 seconds, then press. Builds strength at sticking point without chest touch.

pendlay_row.name: Pendlay Row
pendlay_row.description: From floor each rep, explosive row to lower chest. Dead stop start builds pure pulling power.

single_leg_rdl.name: Single-Leg Romanian Deadlift
single_leg_rdl.description: Hinge on one leg, other leg extends behind. Balance and hamstring work. Control throughout.

isometric_pause_squat.name: Isometric Pause Squat Hold
isometric_pause_squat.description: Hold at bottom of squat for extended duration. Builds positional strength and stability.

isometric_loaded_stretch.name: Isometric Loaded Stretch
isometric_loaded_stretch.description: Hold stretched position under load. Develops strength through full range of motion.

front_squat_pause.name: Front Squat with Pause
front_squat_pause.description: 2-second pause at bottom. Core stability with heavy load.

z_press.name: Z-Press
z_press.description: Seated on floor pressing. Eliminates leg drive, pure upper body strength.

cable_low_high_rotation.name: Cable Low-to-High Rotation
cable_low_high_rotation.description: Upward rotation pattern with full hip engagement.

isometric_dead_bug.name: Isometric Dead Bug Hold
isometric_dead_bug.description: Limbs extended, lower back pressed down. Core stability hold.

barbell_hip_thrust.name: Barbell Hip Thrust
barbell_hip_thrust.description: Bar across hips, drive hips up. Maximum glute power for drive phase.
barbell_hip_thrust.notes: Full hip extension, squeeze at top

half_kneel_anti_rotation.name: Half-Kneeling Cable Anti-Rotation
half_kneel_anti_rotation.description: Half-kneel position, cable at chest height, resist rotation. Trains trunk stability.

isometric_glute_bridge.name: Isometric Glute Bridge Hold
isometric_glute_bridge.description: Hips elevated, single or double leg. Glute endurance for repeated drive phase activation.

pushup_variations.name: Push-Up Variations
pushup_variations.description: Standard, diamond, or archer push-ups. Shoulder stability with bodyweight control.

face_pulls.name: Face Pulls
face_pulls.description: Cable at face height, pull to ears with external rotation. Crucial for posterior shoulder health.
face_pulls.notes: Elbows high, external rotation at finish

hip_thrust.name: Hip Thrust
hip_thrust.description: Heavy hip thrusts for glute power. Maximal drive phase force production.

medball_scoop_toss.name: Med Ball Scoop Toss
medball_scoop_toss.description: Explosive hip extension with med ball throw. Power transfer drill.

back_squat.name: Back Squat
back_squat.description: Heavy squatting for leg strength. Deep depth with controlled descent.

barbell_bench_press.name: Barbell Bench Press
barbell_bench_press.description: Heavy pressing for upper body power. Chest and tricep strength for acceleration.

half_kneel_chop.name: Half-Kneeling Cable Chop
half_kneel_chop.description: Rotational power from half-kneeling. Hip and core integration.

lateral_lunge.name: Lateral Lunge
lateral_lunge.description: Lateral strength for hip mobility and adductor strength.

face_pulls_ext_rot.name: Face Pulls with External Rotation
face_pulls_ext_rot.description: Added external rotation at peak contraction. Maximum posterior shoulder work.

single_arm_landmine.name: Single-Arm Landmine Press
single_arm_landmine.description: Unilateral pressing with rotational element. Core stability demand.

eccentric_trap_bar.name: Eccentric Trap Bar Deadlift
eccentric_trap_bar.description: 5-second lowering phase. Maximum muscle tension during eccentric.

eccentric_squat.name: Eccentric Squat
eccentric_squat.description: 5-second descent, explode up. Eccentric muscle loading.

eccentric_bench.name: Eccentric Bench Press
eccentric_bench.description: 5-second lowering to chest. Builds chest and tricep mass.

eccentric_rdl.name: Eccentric RDL
eccentric_rdl.description: 4-second lowering with hamstring focus. Time under tension for growth.

eccentric_bulgarian.name: Eccentric Bulgarian Split Squat
eccentric_bulgarian.description: 4-second descent on each rep. Quad hypertrophy focus.

eccentric_overhead.name: Eccentric Overhead Press
eccentric_overhead.description: 4-second lowering from lockout. Shoulder mass building.

eccentric_single_row.name: Eccentric Single-Arm Row
eccentric_single_row.description: 4-second negative each rep. Unilateral back development.

eccentric_step_down.name: Eccentric Step-Down
eccentric_step_down.description: Controlled single-leg lowering from box. Quad eccentric strength.

eccentric_incline.name: Eccentric Incline Press
eccentric_incline.description: 4-second lowering on incline. Upper chest development.

eccentric_lat_pulldown.name: Eccentric Lat Pulldown
eccentric_lat_pulldown.description: 4-second return to start. Lat eccentric loading.

eccentric_nordic.name: Eccentric Nordic Curl
eccentric_nordic.description: Slow eccentric hamstring lowering. Injury prevention focus.

eccentric_dip.name: Eccentric Dip
eccentric_dip.description: 5-second lowering phase. Tricep and chest development.

tempo_front_squat.name: Tempo Front Squat
tempo_front_squat.description: 4-second descent, 2-second pause, explode up. Total time under tension.

negative_pullup.name: Negative Pull-Up
negative_pullup.description: Jump to top, 6-second lowering. Builds pulling strength.

eccentric_lateral_lunge.name: Eccentric Lateral Lunge
eccentric_lateral_lunge.description: 4-second lowering into lateral lunge. Adductor development.

landmine_press.name: Landmine Press
landmine_press.description: Single-arm press with landmine bar. Scapular-friendly overhead pressing with rotational element.

speed_swings_10.name: Speed Swings - 10 Reps
speed_swings_10.description: Maximum effort speed swings with game bat. Focus on bat speed over contact quality.

connection_ball.name: Connection Ball Drill
connection_ball.description: Squeeze foam ball between arms and torso during swing. Maintains upper body connection.

bat_behind_back.name: Bat Behind Back Rotations
bat_behind_back.description: Hold bat across shoulders behind back. Practice hip rotation driving shoulders.

wrist_snap.name: Wrist Snap Drill
wrist_snap.description: Quick wrist snaps at contact point. Develops fast hands through the zone.

resistance_band_swings.name: Resistance Band Speed Swings
resistance_band_swings.description: Attach band to bat for overload. Swing against resistance for power.

one_handed_swings.name: One-Handed Speed Swings
one_handed_swings.description: Top or bottom hand only swings. Develops hand independence and bat control.

quick_hands.name: Quick Hands Drill
quick_hands.description: Partner tosses balls from short distance. Quick reactions, short swings.

swing_speed_measure.name: Swing Speed Measurement
swing_speed_measure.description: Track bat speed with swing analyzer. Record progress over time.

bat_waggle.name: Bat Waggle Speed Drill
bat_waggle.description: Rapid bat movement at stance. Keeps hands loose and ready.

speed_tee_15.name: Speed Tee Work - 15 Swings
speed_tee_15.description: Full speed swings off tee. Focus on max bat speed, not mechanics.

velocity_ladder.name: Velocity Ladder Swings
velocity_ladder.description: Progressive speed increase: 70%, 80%, 90%, 100%. Build to max.

bat_flip_speed.name: Bat Flip Speed Drill
bat_flip_speed.description: Flip bat end-over-end quickly. Develops wrist speed and control.

no_stride_swings.name: No-Stride Speed Swings
no_stride_swings.description: Swing from stance without stride. Isolates upper body speed.

fast_hands_reaction.name: Fast Hands Reaction Drill
fast_hands_reaction.description: Colored ball toss - swing only at specific color. Quick decision making.

exit_speed_comp.name: Exit Speed Competition
exit_speed_comp.description: Compete for highest exit velocity off tee or soft toss.
exit_speed_comp.notes: Track exit speed, beat personal best

rotational_snap.name: Rotational Snap Drill
rotational_snap.description: Focus on explosive hip rotation to initiate swing. Hips lead hands.

light_bat_20.name: Light Bat Max Speed - 20 Swings
light_bat_20.description: Speed bat or lighter bat for overspeed training. Move it fast.

heavy_light_contrast.name: Heavy-Light Contrast - 10 Sets
heavy_light_contrast.description: Alternate between heavy bat and light bat swings. Contrast training effect.

intent_tee_max.name: Intent Tee Work - Max Effort
intent_tee_max.description: Maximum intent swings off tee. Every swing is game swing effort.

barrel_speed_focus.name: Barrel Speed Focus Drill
barrel_speed_focus.description: Focus on barrel acceleration through the zone. Whip the barrel.

overload_underload.name: Overload/Underload Protocol
overload_underload.description: Complete protocol with weighted and speed bats. Full contrast session.

jband_internal.name: J-Band Internal Rotation
jband_internal.description: Elbow at 90¬∞, rotate hand inward against band resistance. Controlled motion.

jband_external.name: J-Band External Rotation
jband_external.description: Elbow at 90¬∞, rotate hand outward against band resistance. Strengthen external rotators.

jband_scap.name: J-Band Scap Retraction
jband_scap.description: Pull band apart at chest height. Squeeze shoulder blades together.

jband_high_pulls.name: J-Band High Pulls
jband_high_pulls.description: Arms overhead with band, pull apart while maintaining tension.

sleeper_stretch.name: Sleeper Stretch
sleeper_stretch.description: Lie on throwing side, push wrist toward floor with other hand. Internal rotation stretch.

crossbody_stretch.name: Cross-Body Stretch
crossbody_stretch.description: Pull throwing arm across body with other arm. Posterior shoulder stretch.
crossbody_stretch.notes: Hold 30s, feel stretch in back of shoulder

wrist_flex_ext.name: Wrist Flexion/Extension
wrist_flex_ext.description: Curl and extend wrist with light weight. Forearm strength for arm health.

forearm_pro_sup.name: Forearm Pronation/Supination
forearm_pro_sup.description: Rotate forearm palm up and palm down with light weight. Wrist mobility.

long_toss_60.name: Long Toss Warm-Up - 60ft
long_toss_60.description: Easy throws at 60 feet. Arm path warm-up, not velocity focused.

long_toss_90.name: Long Toss Build - 90ft
long_toss_90.description: Increase distance to 90 feet. Medium effort, building arm speed.

long_toss_120.name: Long Toss Extension - 120ft
long_toss_120.description: Extend to 120 feet. Higher arc allowed, building arm strength.

long_toss_max.name: Long Toss Max - 150-200ft
long_toss_max.description: Maximum comfortable distance. Arc throws for arm conditioning.

pulldown_phase.name: Pull-Down Phase
pulldown_phase.description: Work back from max distance with pull-down throws. Line drive trajectory.

velo_day_gun.name: Velo Day - Gun Readings
velo_day_gun.description: Velocity focused session with radar readings. Track max and average.

weighted_7oz.name: Weighted Ball - 7oz Overload
weighted_7oz.description: Heavy ball throws for arm strength. Controlled intent.

weighted_5oz.name: Weighted Ball - 5oz Standard
weighted_5oz.description: Game weight ball or standard 5oz weighted ball.

weighted_4oz.name: Weighted Ball - 4oz Underload
weighted_4oz.description: Light ball for arm speed development. Move it fast.

contrast_throws.name: Contrast Throws
contrast_throws.description: Alternate between overload and underload balls. Contrast training effect.

crow_hop.name: Crow Hop Throws
crow_hop.description: Throw with crow hop for momentum and timing. Build arm speed.

max_intent_bp.name: Max Intent Bullpen
max_intent_bp.description: Bullpen session at maximum intent. Game-like velocity focus.

plyocare_pivot.name: PlyoCare Pivot Pickoffs
plyocare_pivot.description: Pivot throw drill with plyocare ball. Quick feet and arm action.

plyocare_rollins.name: PlyoCare Roll-Ins
plyocare_rollins.description: Roll into throw with plyocare ball. Hip lead and arm follow.

plyocare_reverse.name: PlyoCare Reverse Throws
plyocare_reverse.description: Back to target, rotate and throw. Rotation sequencing.

rocker_throws.name: Rocker Throws
rocker_throws.description: Rock back and throw with momentum. Timing and weight transfer.

curve_grip.name: Curveball Grip Work
curve_grip.description: Practice grip variations, finding comfortable finger pressure and seam orientation.

curve_spin.name: Curveball Spin Drills
curve_spin.description: Short distance spins focusing on tight rotation and axis. See the spin.

curve_shape.name: Curveball Shape Focus
curve_shape.description: Full distance curves, focusing on consistent break shape and depth.

slider_grip.name: Slider Grip Work
slider_grip.description: Practice slider grip with finger pressure on inner seam. Find your comfort zone.

slider_wrist.name: Slider Wrist Action
slider_wrist.description: Isolate slider release action. Bullet spin with tight dot.

slider_tunnel.name: Slider Tunnel Drill
slider_tunnel.description: Throw slider through fastball tunnel, late break for deception.

changeup_grip.name: Changeup Grip Work
changeup_grip.description: Circle change, 3-finger, or other grip variations. Find what works.

changeup_arm_speed.name: Changeup Arm Speed Matching
changeup_arm_speed.description: Match fastball arm speed with changeup grip. Deception is key.

changeup_feel.name: Changeup Feel Drills
changeup_feel.description: Short distance changeups developing touch and feel for speed differential.

quadrant_work.name: Quadrant Work
quadrant_work.description: Hit specific quadrants of strike zone. Build precision command.

glove_arm_side.name: Glove Side/Arm Side
glove_arm_side.description: Work both edges of plate. Develop horizontal command.

up_down_ladder.name: Up/Down Ladder
up_down_ladder.description: Work top and bottom of zone. Vertical command development.

pitch_sequencing.name: Pitch Sequencing
pitch_sequencing.description: Practice 2 and 3 pitch sequences. Build game-like patterns.

tunnel_drills.name: Tunnel Drills
tunnel_drills.description: Throw different pitches through same tunnel. Develop deception.
